instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus - 12.28V
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus - 12.28V
SMBUS one line at 3,4V and other line at 1.04V
Pullup resistors are ok. I interchanged them

I already replaced SMC 2 times
ISL 6259 1 time

Have no more idea where is the problem...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus - 12.28V
threads.message: If you're confident your SMCs and ISLs are good, check <CAPACITOR>C6952</CAPACITOR>/<CAPACITOR>C6953</CAPACITOR> (whichever line is 1.04v). That cap can short it

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus - 12.28V
threads.message: <DIODE>D6950</DIODE> is also a good suspect. I hope you left the battery indicator disconnected as that can also mess up the data lines.
